alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Reeves County Plains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 8:42PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pecos and east central Reeves Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 842 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southeast of Barstow, or 19 miles southeast of Pecos, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coyanosa and B F Goodrich Testing Track. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
